shortdesc.ph: Sets the blocklist of users whose audio streams are not subscribed.
Sets the blocklist for audio stream subscription.

p.codeblock: virtual int setSubscribeAudioBlocklistEx(uid_t* uidList, int uidNumber, const RtcConnection& connection) = 0;
public abstract int setSubscribeAudioBlocklistEx(int[] uidList, RtcConnection connection);

section.p: You can call this method to specify the users whose audio streams you do not want to subscribe to.

ul.li: You can call this method before or after joining a channel.
The blocklist is not affected by , , or the autoSubscribeAudio setting in .
Once the subscription blocklist is set, it remains effective even if you leave and rejoin the current channel.
If a user is added to both the allowlist and blocklist, only the blocklist takes effect.
You can call this method before or after joining a channel.
The blocklist setting is not affected by , , or the autoSubscribeAudio setting in .
Once the blocklist is set, it remains effective even if you leave and rejoin the channel.
If a user is added to both the allowlist and blocklist, only the blocklist takes effect.

section.title: Scenario
section.p: This method applies to multi-channel scenarios.

plentry.pd: The list of user IDs whose audio streams you do not want to subscribe to. To remove a user from the blocklist, you need to call the method to update the user ID list.
The number of users in the user ID list.

The list of user IDs whose audio streams you do not want to subscribe to.
To stop subscribing to a user's audio stream, add the user's ID to this list.
To remove a user from the blocklist, call the method to update the list. That is, only include the user IDs you do not want to subscribe to in the new list.
